conclusion: To analyze shadow changes, consider principles of shadow formation.
Light source is to the left, shadows are cast to the right and elongated horizontally.
As light source moves to the right, angle of light changes to be more perpendicular.
Shadows will move closer to the objects and be directly beneath them.
Shadows will become shorter due to vertical light rays reducing horizontal spread.
In the second image, shadows are shorter and closer to the objects.
Final answer: Shadows move closer, become shorter, and are directly beneath objects.
